item.title: Medication Automated Quotation System, or MEDAQ, Act of 2018

To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing and maintaining an automated and searchable system that tracks prescription drug prices in the United States, and for other purposes.
Medication Automated Quotation System, or MEDAQ, Act of 2018
Medication Automated Quotation System, or MEDAQ, Act of 2018
item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 126 (Thursday, July 26, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DUNCAN of Tennessee:H.R. 6593.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Under Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution,Clause 3: The Congress shall have Power * * * to regulateCommerce with foreign Nations, and among the several States,and with the Indian Tribes.Under Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution,Clause 18: The Congress shall have Power * * * To make allLaws which shall be necessary and proper for carrying intoExecution the foregoing Powers, and all other Powers vestedby the Constitution in the Government of the United States,or in any Department or Officer thereof.[Page H7726]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1096-1097)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
